1.text: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

3.text: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.

4.text: We have drank our water for money; our wood is sold to us.

5.text: Our necks are under persecution: we labor, and have no rest.

6.text: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.

8.text: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.

9.text: We procured our bread with the peril of our lives, because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.

11.text: They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes were hanged by their hand: the faces of elders were not honored.

13.text: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their music.

15.text: The joy of our heart hath ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us, that we have sinned!

17.text: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.

18.text: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.

19.text: Thou, O LORD, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.

20.text: Why dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?

21.text: Turn thou us to thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

22.text: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.
